definitions.body: straight, level, of a way Is 26:7, Je 31:9, Ps 107:7, Ezr 8:21; foot Ez Eze 1:7; wings v:Eze 1:23 (? v. supr.)

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: to God, [[הַיׇּשָׁר בעיני]] that which is right, pleasing in the eyes of, agreeable to (either cstr. before ´[[י]], or with sfs. referring to him), esp. in Deut. writers, Ex 15:26 (R), De 12:25, De 13:19, De 21:9, 1Ki 11:33, 1Ki 11:38, 1Ki 14:8, 1Ki 15:5, 1Ki 15:11, 1Ki 22:43 = 2Ch 20:32, 2Ki 10:30, 2Ki 12:3, 2Ki 14:3, 2Ki 15:3, 2Ki 15:34, 2Ki 16:2, 2Ki 18:3 2Ki 22:3 = 2Ch 24:2, 2Ch 25:2, 2Ch 26:4, 2Ch 27:2, 2Ch 28:1, 2Ch 29:2 2Ch 34:2, Je 34:15; ´[[הישׁר והטוב בעיני י]] De 6:18; ´[[הטוב והישׁר בעיני י]] De 12:28 2Ch 14:1; ´[[הטוב והישׁר והאמת לפני י]] 2Ch 31:20.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: to man, [[ישׁר בעיני]]([[ה]]) De 12:8, Ju Jdg 17:6, Jdg 21:25, 2Sa 19:7, Je 40:5, Pr 12:15, Pr 21:2; [[ישׁר בעיוי]]([[ה]])[[טוב ו]]([[ה]]) Jos 9:25 (D), Je 26:14, Je 40:4; [[יֵשׁ דֶּרֶח יׇשָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִישׁ]] Pr 14:12 there is a way which is pleasing before a man = Pr 16:25.

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: of God, [[חַדִּיק וְיׇשָׁר הוא]] De 32:4 (song); ´[[טוב וישׁר י]] Ps 25:8; ´[[ישׁר י]] Ps 92:15; his ways Ho 14:10; his [[משׁפטים]] Ne 9:13, Ps 119:137; [[פִּקּוּדִים]] Ps 19:9; [[דָּבָר]] Ps 33:4; the words of divine wisdom Pr 8:9.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: of man, God made him upright Ec 7:29; but [[יׇשָׁר בָּאָדָם אָָיִן]] Mic 7:2 an upright man among men there is none and yet Job is [[תָּם וְיׇשָׁר]] Job 1:1 (v. Da), v:Job 1:8, Job 2:3, cf. Ps 37:37; [[זַח וישׁר]] Job 8:6; so earlier of David as an uprightman 1Sa 29:6; of man's doings ‖[[זַח]] Pr 20:11, cf. Pr 21:8; of his way of life ‖[[טובה]] 1Sa 12:23; [[יְשַׁר־דֶּרֶח]] Pr 29:27; [[יִשְׁרֵי־דֶרֶדִּ]] Ps 37:14; of his heart, mind, and will, [[יִשְׁרֵי לֵבָב]] upright of heart 2Ch 29:34; [[יִשְׁרֵי־לֵב]] Ps 7:11, Ps 11:2, Ps 32:11, Ps 36:11, Ps 64:11, Ps 94:15, Ps 97:11; [[יְשָׁרִים בְּלִבּוֹתָם]] Ps 125:4.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: as a noun, (1) with ref. to things, [[יׇשָׁר הֶעֱוֵיתִי]] the right I have perverted Job 33:27; [[הַיְשָׁרָה יְעַקֵָּשׁוּ]] Mic 3:9 pervert the right (lit. twist that which is straight); [[דּׂבֵר יְשָׁרִים]] speaketh right things Pr 16:13, cf. 2Ki 10:15. (2) more commonly of men, in sg. [[יׇשָׁר]]([[ה]]) Mic 2:7, Mic 7:4, 2Ki 10:3, Pr 21:29, Job 23:7; collective, Ps 11:7; also in [[סֵפֶר]] [[הַיׇּשָׁר]] book of the upright Jos 10:13, 2Sa 1:18 (cf. 1Ki 8:53 LXX; Dr:Intr. 182), a collection of ancient national poetry; in pl. [[יְשָׁרִים]] the upright, of pious Israel Nu 23:10 (song E); elsewhere of the upright among the people of God as distinguished from the wicked, in WisdLt. Job 4:7, Job 17:8, Pr 2:7, Pr 2:21, Pr 3:32, Pr 11:3, Pr 11:6, Pr 11:11, Pr 12:6, Pr 14:9, Pr 14:11, Pr 15:8, Pr 15:19, Pr 16:17, Pr 21:18, Pr 28:10, Pr 29:10, in late PsalmPsalm Ps 33:1, Ps 49:15, Ps 107:42, Ps 111:1, Ps 112:2, Ps 112:4, Ps 140:13 and Da 11:17.
abstr., uprightness, [[בֶּאֱמֶת וְיׇשָׁר]] Ps 111:8 (Thes), but read rather [[ישֶׁר]] with Hi Ri Bae, after LXX SyrVer Targum Jer.
